basic.description: It basically bleach. Here's how to use this: You watched a wild dog squatting at your front door, its back door gapes open as a stream of golden bricks slowly...
basic.name: hydrogen peroxide

basic.description: Before you ask, NO, you cannot drink this, damn alcoholics.
basic.name: alcohol

basic.description: Cheap, mass produced lithium battery sold in bulk. Torch, Light, NVG are the few examples that DON'T use this battery (for whatever reason).
basic.name: AAA battery

basic.description: Big and thick enough to be a comfortable sleeping bag. If you're not minding the smell that is.
basic.name: Boar pelt

basic.description: Yes it's a bolt cutter. No it cannot cut fences and chain links. Why? Cause the dev said so, yo can sell it though.
basic.name: Bolt cutter

basic.description: Tiny, easily hidden in plain sight. Perfect for spying on your hated politicians or hot milfs in your area.
basic.name: CCTV camera

basic.description: Not a single functioning car around here. BUT, plenty of uses for a decent battery.
basic.name: car battery

basic.description: Half lead, half copper. Make for good garrote if this game ever have proper stealth and melee mechanic.
basic.name: Copper wire

basic.description: Some people lack these things in their brain. Just saying.
basic.name: CPU

basic.description: Why is this thing the only crystal described by colour again?
basic.name: Violet crystal

basic.description: DANGER! DO NOT TAMPER WITH STUFF YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND! Quite valuable to certain people.
basic.name: Power Grid documents

basic.description: DANGER! DO NOT TAMPER WITH STUFF YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND! Quite valuable to certain people.
basic.name: Lab documents

basic.description: Danberu Nan-Kiro Moteru?
basic.name: Dumbell

basic.description: Gorilla not included.
basic.name: Adhesive tape roll

basic.description: If you leave some of these out in the open, it'll attract some freedom and bald eagles.
basic.name: Engine Oil

basic.description: Useful for hot days and ass ventilation for long hours of games.
basic.name: Fan

basic.description: It's just meat, really!
basic.name: Strange flesh sample

basic.description: Seriously why is this thing so big? Are these designed by Crimson Corp for BIG?
basic.name: Kitchen fork

basic.description: Cologne, idgaf it's for men or women. Good men and women take a good rinse with soap, not spraying these on and skip shower.
basic.name: Fragrance

basic.description: You need batteries and game disks. Which you're guaranteed to never have the latter.
basic.name: Portable GameBoy

basic.description: Totally useless without some form of controller, keyboard and mouse.
basic.name: Games Station

basic.description: DO I LOOK LIKE A TEN FEET TALL MONSTER?!
basic.name: Propane tank

basic.description: You're lucky these grew on ghouls and not Cthulhu nor some lockers. Ask any school girls and they'll tell you about the horrors these represent.
basic.name: ghoul's tentacle

basic.description: This isn't a geiger counter. You got one on you and it doesn't look like this... Wait... You don't have one?
basic.name: gm counter

basic.description: Subscription range from $10 a month for an update every 3 minute to $100 a month for constant real time update.
basic.name: GPS Marker

basic.description: Now all we need is an anvil, then my not-so-terrible-pun is completed.
basic.name: Hammer

basic.description: HO! No no, I was talking about my garden HOSE!
basic.name: Hose

basic.description: Health communities advise you to toss away any and all empty syringe. In Zarkov you're taught to question said advice and reuse them.
basic.name: Syringe

basic.description: Won't do much good in this state, better pass it on to someone who know what to do with this garbage.
basic.name: Ruined Laboratory entrance key

basic.description: Seriously why is this thing so big? Are these designed by Crimson Corp for BIG?
basic.name: Kitchen knife

basic.description: Weather resistant matches in a rugged cardboard box. Well known in the Metro, Chernobyl exclusion zone, Tarkov and NOT HERE!
basic.name: Matches Box

basic.description: A tad longer and I'll be calling this an 'extended barrel' attachment.
basic.name: Metal pipe

basic.description: Systemized Telemetry for Automated Robot Control core. 35 are needed for each control system. Won't do much good for you tho, better sell them off.
basic.name: Military-grade circuit

basic.description: Use this item to build lights
basic.name: Lights kit

basic.description: Fake gold, but very high quality, so it worth something.
basic.name: Golden Necklace

basic.description: Spilling it might cause unwanted misunderstanding.
basic.name: White paint

basic.description: High quality printing papers. Always in need of these.
basic.name: Paper sheets

basic.description: Sleep whenever and wherever you can. The bro you're borrowing his bed won't mind some extra fluff.
basic.name: pillow

basic.description: It might be a pot but I'm tempted to call it a cauldron. I mean it's as big as a car wheel!
basic.name: Cooking pot

basic.description: Small, non-removable name tag on the side reads: Prototype of Professor Sakharov.
basic.name: PSY Helmet (Calibrated)

basic.description: Never wipe with concrete's cardboard or bag no matter how desperate you are. Otherwise the good doc gonna take a sledge hammer on your backdoor upon your next constipation.
basic.name: Concrete box

basic.description: It's like a mystery box, or G-MAN's possession. Why is it so damn heavy anyhow?
basic.name: Briefcase

basic.description: This thing is sealed tight and the cover made out of plastic, better not tamper with it, else you'll fail your quest and lower its value.
basic.name: Secret documents

basic.description: Some random, technical gibberish in here of no interest. TLDR.
basic.name: Zakov fire station documents

basic.description: Included, but not limited to: Orders for guns, ammo, frag grenades, tasers, ... WAIT! FRAG GRENADES?! I thought these guys are cops!
basic.name: Zakov police station documents

basic.description: Erh... What? Do I look like an egghead? I'm not built for these.
basic.name: First part of the Crystal documents

basic.description: Erh... What? Do I look like an egghead? I'm not built for these.
basic.name: Second part of the Crystal documents

basic.description: Included an expenses list for teachers, paper bags, erasers, rulers, foods, drinks, cakes, parties, new transfer students, whips, aphrosidiac, etc...
basic.name: Documents found in the school

basic.description: Incase you've forgotten, it did not belong to a dog.
basic.name: Vlasov's Dogtag

basic.description: Good ol' fashioned 3 dynamite sticks bundled together, can't have you tossing these around, cause that'll become your budget grenades and we don't want that now do we?
basic.name: Dynamite

basic.description: You know, kinda nasty. I regret gouging these out. Should have taken a picture or something instead.
basic.name: Eye balls (with organic strings)

basic.description: It's encrypted. With password and all. Woulda love to see what's in it, maybe the new PlayGuy limited edition redeem code?
basic.name: USB drive found in the sawmill

basic.description: It's kinda stained red. I bet there's a list of tenants in here along with their respective super powers.
basic.name: Secret documents

basic.description: It's glowing pink so it's definitely strange! What kind of diabolical eletronic painted pink?!
basic.name: Strange circuit

basic.description: I can't read these, whoever written these must'ave been the village's doctor!
basic.name: Secret documents

basic.description: Weight a ton, probably good stuff inside. Too bad quest items are permanently sealed.
basic.name: Equipment case

basic.description: It's sooooo alluring and attractive, inviting me with that big, thich LOOT promt...
basic.name: Lost backpack found in the forest

basic.name: Lost backpack found in the swamp

basic.description: It's better not be a log of processed logs... Get it? Log of Logs? Heh... Ok that was pretty terrible...
basic.name: Lost document found in the forest

basic.description: It's better not be a container for a list of containers... Get it? Container Containing Containers? OOH MAH GAWD NEIN!
basic.name: Lost document found in the industrial area

basic.description: It's better not be a makeshift list of makeshift camps... Get it? Makeshift camp's makeshift list... I'll shut up now.
basic.name: Lost document found in the makeshift camp

basic.description: It's better not be a swamp of unsolvable mires... Get it? Cause it's a swamp document? Pretty sure I'm not cut out for puns.
basic.name: Lost document found in the swamp

basic.description: Signally Transmitted Device... Damn this specific zone with no contrabands!
basic.name: Transmitter

basic.description: Can be used as ear muffs, sock, chest warmer, ass padding or improvised toilet paper.
basic.name: Rabbit pelt

basic.description: I'll be calling it improvised bandages if these are tad bigger and longer.
basic.name: Rags

basic.description: Unidentified Looted Skin...
basic.name: Pelt

basic.description: Find a BIG power pole or pylon, no fusebox. Sometime map generation might screw you over by blocking your path, just extract and start another run.
basic.name: Power grid REPAIR KIT

basic.description: Tower located OUTSIDE of the lab and it's a pylon looking thingy. Look for something like a fusebox underneath.
basic.name: Radio tower REPAIR KIT

basic.description: Smells like zombified Grigoriy.
basic.name: Grigoriy's ring

basic.description: Used to bind various things. Depending on binding style it might need a professional skill set.
basic.name: Rope

basic.description: 50 roubles note. Despite how it looks, papers are heavy and they eat spaces m'kay?
basic.name: Rouble Banknote

basic.description: It'll double the value after it've collected some data .
basic.name: Scientific analyzer

basic.description: Seriously why is this thing so big? Are these designed by Crimson Corp for BIG?
basic.name: Kitchen spoon

basic.description: BEST SELLER OF THE CENTURY! Sold like hot-cakes upon when any form of disaster hit, plague or earthquake or whatever else! GET YOUR NOW!
basic.name: Toilet paper roll

basic.description: This item features StatTrak™ technology, which tracks certain statistics when equipped by its owner.
basic.name: StatTrak™ HiSpeed AssWiper

basic.description: You could stack more, but no one want defective USB, so I'm putting pads in between.
basic.name: USB

basic.description: Seriously, why do people buy these? I haven't seen any car around here.
basic.name: Wheel

basic.description: Multi-purposes wiring, quite durable. Make for good garrote if this game ever have proper stealth and melee mechanic.
basic.name: Wires

basic.description: If you're expecting the same treatment as rabbit pelt, don't. It's too coarse.
basic.name: Wolf pelt
